translated: Lundquist, Viktor Emanuel, music director, Borås, b. 8/8/82 in Karlskoga to civil servant Andreas L. and Emma Hultman. Married in 1907 to Mia Österberg. Children: John b. 1908, Elsa b. 1912, Sven b. 1920. Graduated from music conservatory in 1904. Studied abroad in Denmark, Germany, and Austria. Participated in the Swedish Choir Association's representation choir to Finland in 1932 and 1937, as well as concert tours with various choirs to Norway and Denmark. Directed male choirs and orchestras in Filipstad from 1904-1906, Amål from 1907-1910, and music teacher at Amåls samskola from 1907-1910, at Åmåls folkskola and lärmeseminarium from 1909-1910, at Borås högre allmänna läroverk from 1911-1946, and again from 1927-1935. Organist and choir leader at Caroli Church since 1911. Directed and served as chairman of the Borås Orchestra Association from 1911. Directed and served as conductor for the Ulricehamn Orchestra Association from 1933-1941 and 1946. Directed the Borås Allmänna Sångförening from 1911-1913, the Borås Par Bricole Choir from 1914-1921, and was the chief conductor of the Dalsland Singers' Association from 1910-1933, serving as chairman from 1910-1913. Chief conductor of the Västergötland Singers' Association from 1915-1920, and the third conductor of the Swedish Singers' Association from 1921-1927. Chief conductor and chairman of the Sjuhäradsbygdens Choir Association since 1924, and second conductor of the Swedish Choir Association from 1925-1935, chief conductor from 1935-1945, and honorary member since 1945. Member of the board of the Swedish Orchestral Association since 1935, vice-chairman of the Western District of the Swedish Music Teachers' Association from 1939-1943, and the Skara Diocese Organists' and Conductors' Association since 1935. Member of the Swedish Church Singers' Association's central council since 1925, member of the jury for awards in the Swedish Choir Association, Society for the Promotion of Swedish Quartet Singing, and the Swedish Church Singers' Association. Member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellows, and Par Bricole. Composed cantatas for soloists, choir, and orchestra for various purposes. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, Swedish Singers' Association, Dalsland Singers' Association, and the Swedish Orchestral Association's merits. Honored with the Swedish Choir Association's merit badge and the Patriot Grand Medal in 1947, as well as an Associate of the Free Music Academy.
